description: A seminar on the American city, in historical and architectural perspective. Topics include the development of American from a rural to a predominantly urban society; the evolving architecture and urban form of the American city; the role of the automobile, transportation, and mobility in urban planning and development; cycles of urban growth, neglect, decay, and redevelopment; and the role of heritage and preservation in the contemporary city. The class will also view aspects of the American city in international perspective.
title: The American City: History and Architecture
